intro: Vincetoxicum auriculatum, commonly known as the golden-weed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a distinctive auriculate base, giving it its common name. It produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in summer. The plant is often found in moist, shady areas and can spread aggressively through its rhizomes.
